t: 1 Samuel 1
Now*p there was a certain man of Ramathaimâ€“zophim, of mount Ephraim, and his name was Elkanah, the son of Jeroham, the son of Elihu, the son of Tohu, the son of Zuph, an Ephrathite:
And*p he had two wives; the name of the one was Hannah, and the name of the other Peninnah: and Peninnah had children, but Hannah had no children.
And*p this man went up out of his city yearly to worship and to sacrifice unto the Lord*s of hosts in Shiloh. And the two sons of Eli, Hophni and Phinehas, the priests of the Lord,*s were there.
And*p when the time was that Elkanah offered, he gave to Peninnah his wife, and to all her sons and her daughters, portions:
But*p unto Hannah he gave a worthy portion; for he loved Hannah: but the Lord*s had shut up her womb.
And*p her adversary also provoked her sore, for to make her fret, because the Lord*s had shut up her womb.
And*p as he did so year by year, when she went up to the house of the Lord,*s so she provoked her; therefore she wept, and did not eat.
Then*p said Elkanah her husband to her, Hannah, why weepest thou? and why eatest thou not? and why is thy heart grieved? am not I better to thee than ten sons?
So*p Hannah rose up after they had eaten in Shiloh, and after they had drunk. Now Eli the priest sat upon a seat by a post of the temple of the Lord.*s
And*p she was in bitterness of soul, and prayed unto the Lord,*s and wept sore.

And*p she vowed a vow, and said, O Lord*s of hosts, if thou wilt indeed look on the affliction of thine handmaid, and remember me, and not forget thine handmaid, but wilt give unto thine handmaid a man child, then I will give him unto the Lord*s all the days of his life, and there shall no razor come upon his head.
And*p it came to pass, as she continued praying before the Lord,*s that Eli marked her mouth.
Now*p Hannah, she spake in her heart; only her lips moved, but her voice was not heard: therefore Eli thought she had been drunken.
And*p Eli said unto her, How long wilt thou be drunken? put away thy wine from thee.
And*p Hannah answered and said, No, my lord, I am a woman of a sorrowful spirit: I have drunk neither wine nor strong drink, but have poured out my soul before the Lord.*s
Count*p not thine handmaid for a daughter of Belial: for out of the abundance of my complaint and grief have I spoken hitherto.
Then*p Eli answered and said, Go in peace: and the God of Israel grant thee thy petition that thou hast asked of him.
And*p she said, Let thine handmaid find grace in thy sight. So the woman went her way, and did eat, and her countenance was no more sad.
And*p they rose up in the morning early, and worshipped before the Lord,*s and returned, and came to their house to Ramah: and Elkanah knew Hannah his wife; and the Lord*s remembered her.
Wherefore*p it came to pass, when the time was come about after Hannah had conceived, that she bare a son, and called his name Samuel, saying, Because I have asked him of the Lord.*s
And*p the man Elkanah, and all his house, went up to offer unto the Lord*s the yearly sacrifice, and his vow.
But*p Hannah went not up; for she said unto her husband, I will not go up until the child be weaned, and then I will bring him, that he may appear before the Lord,*s and there abide for ever.

And*p Elkanah her husband said unto her, Do what seemeth thee good; tarry until thou have weaned him; only the Lord*s establish his word. So the woman abode, and gave her son suck until she weaned him.

And*p when she had weaned him, she took him up with her, with three bullocks, and one ephah of flour, and a bottle of wine, and brought him unto the house of the Lord*s in Shiloh: and the child was young.
And*p they slew a bullock, and brought the child to Eli.
And*p she said, Oh my lord, as thy soul liveth, my lord, I am the woman that stood by thee here, praying unto the Lord.*s
For*p this child I prayed; and the Lord*s hath given me my petition which I asked of him:
Therefore*p also I have lent him to the Lord;*s as long as he liveth he shall be lent to the Lord.*s And he worshipped the Lord*s there.
